Doesn't look like anthing to do with debug - moving to core.

This might have been caused by a previous crash / error of eclipse. Take a look 
in the log at the previous session.

Created an attachment (id=8126)
log file showing the consistant Exception.

I noticed that there are two version of org.apache.lucene in your configuration.

By any chance have you installed Eclipse by extracting it on top of an existing
install?

Darin, could you please look at the stack trace attached (the second session) ? 
It shows that an NPE occured while shuting down debug.

Debug is being shutdown by the start level service (requisite order is not being
honored). That should be the reason for the NPE during shutdown.

The plugin stopper (which ensures requisite order is honored) did not run for
some reason, and the best I can think of is a bogus install (and there is some
evidence of that).
I installed 3.0M7 over 3.0M6.  Is there documentation that says to not do this?

I'm not sure there if there is a doc saying "don't do that". However, I doubt 
there is a doc saying "do that" either. To be safe, you should make a clean 
install.

There is no doc saying don't do that but there have been various bug reports, 
mailing list and newsgroup posts to that effect.  Basically it is never safe to 
do that.  Especially with software under development.  Things move, names 
change, etc etc.  If you unzip over top you don't get the deletions.

It is not in big red words, but it is in the Eclipse help:

http://help.eclipse.org/help21/topic/org.eclipse.platform.doc.user/tasks/tasks-2.htm

(I am not saying that it is enough, though. A "Installing Eclipse" section in
the README would be better).

See bug 52761.

traces.message: Legacy plug-in "org.eclipse.debug.core" must not be automatically activated on startup. This is probably caused by a previous crash in Eclipse.
